result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavada D Draper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lavada D Draper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lavada D Draper was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 2:57 PM Defendant Lavada D Draper in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Lavada D Draper. Attorney Forehand moves to amend to 79.4 with 25 plus costs. So order with 60 dtp. Count 2 will be dismissed.
Conditions modified 4/18/22 to: "No violent or abusive contact." (This bond and these modified conditions not in effect until the Defendant signs the bond.)
Amended to "No Violent or Abusive Contact"
for Modification or Criminal No-Contact Condition
Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:03 PM Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video means for Defendant Lavada D Draper. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lavada D Draper appeared by video means. Attorney Richards waives the formal reading and enters a NG plea on both counts. Max penalties stated. Defendant speaks about no contact being dropped to get her dog. Court speaks about having law enforcement go with her to get her dog.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
